phase1.title:
Dawn of doubts
Phase 1
phase1.intro_short:
They told me they were all monsters...
They told me so much evil, so much misfortune about them...
But I preferred to go see for myself.
phase1.intro_full:
They told me they were all
monsters...
They told me so much evil,
so much misfortune
about them...
But I,
I preferred to go see
for myself...
phase1.reaction: NO we can't let that pass!
phase1.text:
They told me they were all
monsters...
They told me so much evil,
so much misfortune
about them...
But I,
I preferred to go see
for myself...

phase2.text:
Who were they really?...
And I saw...
A father... a mother...
children...
All simply seeking to live
their best life...
Like me.

phase3.text:
Then, the moon appeared.
The sky darkened
like a page burned
by time.
A fin split the dark
waves...
Lightning streaked
the gray clouds.

And with them came the evils...
The discord...

phase4.text:
Hatred...
Destruction...
Theft, lies,
Manipulation...
Greed and avarice,
Like invisible chains,
Gripping the hearts of men.

phase5.text:
I was told not to listen
to their cries...
I was told not to let
the storm scare me.
For the storm,
as loud as it may be,
never lasts
forever.

phase6.text:
And if the tempest roars,
it's perhaps
to remind mankind
that beyond the clouds,
there is always
a light.
But to see it,
one must first cross
the night...

phase7.text:
I was told...
that humanity no longer existed,
that it was lost
in wars
and grudges.
I was told that people
no longer welcomed
anyone,
that they locked themselves
behind walls of iron
and fear...

phase8.text:
But I saw…
A hand extended to a stranger.
A smile shared
despite hunger.
A door opened
for one who trembled
in the night...

phase9.text:
That is
hospitality:
not giving what we have in excess,
but sharing
even what is lacking...

phase10.text:
I was told that freedom
was just a word,
an illusion
that the powerful
sold to the weak.
But I saw…
A child running barefoot
in the rain,
laughing without chains,
and in their laughter,
I understood that freedom
lives first in the soul.

phase11.text:
I was told that people
no longer helped,
that each lived only for themselves.
But I saw…
Strangers lifting together
a stone too heavy,
and in this shared strength,
I saw love being born.

phase12.text:
I was told that love
was fragile,
but I saw
that it is stronger
than hatred,
for it builds
when hatred
destroys...

phase13.text:
I was told that tolerance
was a weakness,
but I saw that it is
a wisdom:
that of recognizing
that we are not all
alike...
And that is
life's treasure,
the path to
peace.

phase14.text:
Diversity…
It is not a danger,
it is a treasure.
Like the colors
of a rainbow,
it's their difference
that creates beauty.

phase15.text:
And in this blend
of humanity,
I understood
that we are
one people,
bound by the same
thirst to live,
to create,
and to love.

phase16.text:
The journey begins,
and I wish you fair winds.

May the wind always carry you further,
where happiness is free.

Where borders become
promises, hopes,
projects of new life.

Don't stop at the walls
that stand before you
frightening and cold,
never give up,
break down the walls,
of fear, shame, resentment, hatred,
to be like a lighthouse for others.

phase17.text:
In the distance… I see a wall.
A wall erected in the sea like a scar.
A wall that is not made of stones,
but of laws, papers and closed gazes.

phase18.text:
This wall is the prison of human freedom.
It separates those who can run without chains,
and those locked within invisible borders.

phase19.text:
For the poor, it is barbed with refusal,
closed like a rusted door.
They knock on it with bare hands,
their dreams broken by the silence of guardians.

phase20.text:
For the rich, it is a golden gate.
It opens effortlessly,
and lets them circulate like wind that has no homeland.

phase21.text:
Then I wonder…
Is freedom truly a right,
or has it become a privilege sold to the highest bidders?

phase22.text:
But in the heart of the waves,
the sea whispers a truth:
no wall is eternal.
For water always wears away stone,
and freedom, sooner or later,
will resume its path.

phase23.text:
👁️ Thus ends this journey...

You have navigated through storms,
broken the walls of ignorance,
and discovered that truth
is not an end,
but a path.

Each riddle solved,
each choice made,
brought you closer to this wisdom:

💫 We are all
guardians of the light.

Diversity is not a threat,
but the most beautiful of treasures.

⛵ The journey continues...
In your heart, in your choices,
in your way of seeing the world.

--Emmanuel Payet

narrative.walls_message:
These walls are ours,
we create them through our conflicts,
through hatred and racism,
intolerance of others,
fear of the unknown.

It is us, through our silences and ills,
through our whispered fears,
through our words thrown like stones,
who make them stronger.

They are walls of selfishness,
built with what could have been roofs,
shelters, homes.
narrative.final_message:
Humanity doesn't need walls to protect itself,
but bridges to meet.

Let's build with love, not with fear.
A united world is better than a divided world.

- Emmanuel.gallery

humanity.name: Humanity
humanity.description: The force that unites all hearts
humanity.revelation: Humanity resides in our ability to feel compassion for others, even for those who are different from us.
humanity.wisdom: A father, a mother, children... All simply seeking to live their best life, like us.

wall_of_fear.name: Wall of Fear
wall_of_fear.description: The ancestral origin of our borders
wall_of_fear.mystery: Why do these old animal reflexes remain?
wall_of_fear.revelation: Walls and borders come from fear and the past madness of territorial war, or the fear of losing ground, of being invaded by enemies. Fortresses were then logical and necessary for protection, since prehistoric caves simply to protect from animals. But today why do these walls persist?
wall_of_fear.wisdom: From prehistoric cave to modern wall, ancestral fear persists. But are we still frightened animals, or can we become human?

peace.name: Peace
peace.mystery: How do we find peace in a world of chaos?
peace.revelation: Peace is born when we choose to love rather than hate, to understand rather than judge.
peace.wisdom: Beyond the clouds, there is always light. But to see it, you must first go through the night.

diversity.name: Diversity
diversity.mystery: Why do we fear what is different?
diversity.revelation: Diversity is the wealth of the world. Each color, each culture brings its own beauty to the human rainbow.
diversity.wisdom: They told me so much evil about them... But I preferred to go see for myself.

freedom.name: Freedom
freedom.description: The right to live without chains
freedom.revelation: Freedom is not the absence of constraints, but the ability to choose love despite fear.
freedom.wisdom: Greed and avarice, like invisible chains, tighten men's hearts.

faith.name: Faith
faith.description: The hope that guides in darkness
faith.mystery: How to keep faith when all seems lost?
faith.revelation: To want freedom is also to grant it to others. Freedom will then be beneficial to all and bring peace.
faith.wisdom: For wanting to free oneself from chains is also an act of faith.

respect.name: Respect
respect.description: The dignity given to each being
respect.mystery: How to respect those we don't understand?
respect.revelation: Respect is born from recognizing that each being carries a divine spark within.
respect.wisdom: They locked themselves behind walls of iron and fear... But humanity still existed.

mutual_aid.name: Mutual Aid
mutual_aid.mystery: Why help those who can give us nothing?
mutual_aid.revelation: In mutual aid, we discover that giving enriches us more than receiving.
mutual_aid.wisdom: Love, stronger than all barriers, unites beyond differences.

healing.name: Healing
healing.mystery: How do we heal invisible wounds?
healing.revelation: True healing begins with acceptance and continues with forgiveness.
healing.wisdom: If the storm rumbles, it's to remind us that beyond the clouds, there is always light.

restoration.name: Restoration
restoration.revelation: Every end contains within it the seeds of a new beginning.
restoration.wisdom: A light in the darkness... Hope possible when we choose to love.

avarice.name: Avarice
avarice.revelation: Avarice builds walls where love would build bridges.
avarice.wisdom: A wall raised in the sea like a scar... A wall not made of stones, but of laws, papers and closed eyes.

prison_freedom.name: Prison of Freedom
prison_freedom.revelation: Freedom is not a privilege to distribute, but a universal right to honor.
prison_freedom.wisdom: This wall is the prison of human freedom. It separates those who can run without chains, and those locked in invisible borders.

refusal.name: Refusal
refusal.mystery: Why do we close our doors?
refusal.revelation: Each refusal is a wound inflicted on the humanity we all share.
refusal.wisdom: Barbed wire of iron and fear... forged by those who forgot they too were once travelers.

pride.name: Pride
pride.description: The ego that distorts our view
pride.mystery: Why do we see others as inferior?
pride.revelation: Pride and ego make us see smaller or poorer people differently, but we are all equal in humanity.
pride.wisdom: A golden gate that opens only for a few... Our ego makes us believe we deserve it, and others don't.

inequality.name: Inequality
inequality.mystery: Why do some bear the burden of others?
inequality.revelation: Inequalities are not fate, but a system we perpetuate in silence.
inequality.wisdom: A pyramid of stacked destinies... Those below bear the weight of those above, and none ask if it's fair.

hope.name: Hope
hope.description: The freedom that cannot be imprisoned
hope.revelation: May hope fill your hearts, keep the course with perseverance, let God's wind push you, and fear not the impossible.
hope.wisdom: In the heart of the waves, the sea whispers a truth: no wall is eternal. For water always wears down stone, and freedom, sooner or later, will find its way again.

lighthouse.name: The Lighthouse in the Night
lighthouse.mystery: How to find your way in darkness?
lighthouse.revelation: Light is stronger than night. Even a small flame can dispel the deepest darkness.
lighthouse.wisdom: In the darkest moments, be the light you seek. Compassion illuminates even the most darkened hearts.

lamp.name: The Lamp Filled with Oil
lamp.description: The love that illuminates our works
lamp.mystery: What is the source of our inner light?
lamp.revelation: Love illuminates our works. Without love, we are the shadow of nothing.
lamp.wisdom: Our actions only make sense when guided by love. It transforms emptiness into fullness, shadow into light.

heart.name: The Heart of Humanity
heart.description: The very essence of our shared humanity
heart.mystery: What unites us all beyond our differences?
heart.revelation: In the heart of every human being beats the same love, the same hopes, the same fears. We are one.
heart.wisdom: The journey ends where it began: in the heart. By recognizing our common humanity, we find true peace.

humanity_no_borders.name: Humanity Without Borders
humanity_no_borders.mystery: Do borders define who we are?
humanity_no_borders.revelation: Humanity knows no borders. We are all travelers on the same earth.
humanity_no_borders.wisdom: A father, a mother, children... simply seeking to live, like all of us.

right_to_happiness.name: Right to Happiness
right_to_happiness.revelation: Everyone has the right to happiness, shelter, a roof. Let's build houses and bridges with useful walls, walls of love for families who need them.
right_to_happiness.wisdom: Walls should not separate, but protect. Bridges should not divide, but unite.

precious_life.name: Precious Life
precious_life.mystery: Do all lives have the same value?
precious_life.revelation: Every life is precious, whether born here or elsewhere.
precious_life.wisdom: Life is not measured by its origin, but by its essence.

communitarianism.name: Communitarianism
communitarianism.mystery: Why do our divisions weaken us?
communitarianism.revelation: Socially important but dangerous in dictatorial excesses. We find communitarianism everywhere, from politics and its divisions, to religions and atheist sects. Each fights their battle, the human struggle with their vision, their heart. Community is good, but destroying others' ideas, without tolerance and respect, doesn't help humanity progress.
communitarianism.wisdom: Our political and religious sectarianism destroys bridges, destroys peace. We need this drive to fulfill others' projects, help them succeed, consolidate rather than hastily destroy others' ideas. Without tolerance, no progress.
